Control of ragwort
	After section 1 of the Weeds Act [1959 (c. 54)](/id/ukpga/1959/54?view=plain"Go to item of legislation") there is inserted—
	“1ACode of practice: ragwort
		The Minister may make a code of practice for the purpose of providingguidance on how to prevent the spread of ragwort ( _senecio jacobaea L._ ).
		Before making the code the Minister must consult such persons as heconsiders appropriate.
		The Minister must lay a copy of the code before Parliament.
		The Minister may revise the code; and subsections (2) and (3) apply to therevised code.
		The code is to be admissible in evidence.
		If the code appears to a court to be relevant to any question arising inproceedings it is to be taken into account in determining that question.”
Wales 
	The reference to the Weeds Act 1959 in Schedule 1 to the National Assemblyfor Wales (Transfer of Functions) Order 1999 ([S.I.1999/672](/id/uksi/1999/672?view=plain "Go to item of legislation")) is to betreated as referring to that Act as amended by this Act.
	Subsection (1) does not affect the power to make further Orders varying oromitting that reference.
Short title, commencement and extent
	This Act may be cited as the Ragwort Control Act 2003.
	This Act comes into force at the end of the period of three monthsbeginning with the day on which it is passed.
	This Act extends to England and Wales only.
